It does really well with light, but not so well in darkness. If you want to make a video in a dark setting, it is a good idea to go out and get an LED flash light, or find a way to get some light on the subject. Both Amazon and Ebay sell the LED lighting camera accessory. Also, in order to remove the sound from the video, I ran it through Microsoft's movie maker. Movie Maker can edit videos in HD also, and it's free from Windows. However, that would only be the Windows 7 and 8 editions.

Reviews.Title: decent camera but surprisingly less intuitive than previous model
Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon Powershot Elph, so obviously, I'm a fan of this model.  Between my 1st & 2nd (3 years), i saw a HUGE improvement in sharpness (MP)& zoom, also it was SO intuitive (in particular automatically "brightening" a dim shot (when i didn't want to use flash) & for close-up/macro shots) that I was able to rely on auto setting for all my picture taking needs. When i lost the 2nd camera on vacation, I tried to see the glass as half full & anticipated a even SMARTER, more intuitive camera.  This was listed as the newest model of the one I had lost (with better MP & zoom), but unfortunately, I have found that it's actually LESS intuitive - the auto focus gets confused easily (I would say 15-20% of simple/still pictures come out blurry) & the flash doesn't go off about 20% of the time I think it should, sure these percentages are relatively low but it makes me worry about missed photo opportunities in fleeting moments.  Also, I was annoyed to find that this camera doesn't come with a transfer cord (to plug into usb)or a memory card.  Granted, the measly memory card that came with the previous models were useless but as another reviewer mentioned - then this should be mentioned in the item description.  The item description also doesn't mention transferring photos at all (I haven't read the manual (the camera comes with a quick guide, but if you want the full manual, you have to go online) & maybe this is one of those wifi cameras where you can transfer photos to your smart phone or tablet wirelessly - but this shouldn't eliminate the option of doing it manually).  Luckily, the camera does have the same "port" as the previous model so i was able to use my old transfer cords but there is NO REASON why that shouldn't be included with the camera. On the upside, this camera is smaller, lighter-weight & more streamline, but for my money - i'd rather it be the same size as before & function better.

Reviews.Title: excellent video quality
Reviews.Author: Karen D "Bibliophile"
Reviews.Content: I bought this just to have a point & shoot still camera for my vacation. I bought it because it was bright blue & uses the type of card I liked. It worked fine. Didn't think too much one way or the other. (I couldn't figure out all the settings, but I didn't try too long either)My friends & I decided to make a video & I said I'll bring my camera and act as the VJ (I'm camera shy). I had no idea how good the picture was until I transferred it to my computer. I was literally shocked.I'm so happy I bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Everyday
Reviews.Author: Mike Mcdonald "Trombonist"
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon Rebel T3i for special occasions, but for every day use, this little camera gives me great photos, and is so handy...and much better than my iphone.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive little camera!
Reviews.Author: MK
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera primarily for taking pictures at concerts, as I went to a few this summer I really wanted photos & video from. It is very compact and easy to store, but it packs a punch! It takes great pictures at night even without the flash, I always expect them to come out like moving blurs because of the no light but I was very impressed! The zoom is awesome, really helped get the shots in some far away seats! The video playback looks just like it does recording, clear and no delays and the sound is great! I am also very impressed with the battery life, I was using the camera fast and furious and it barely lost a bar! For the price, and for the size, this camera does the job!

Reviews.Title: Another great camera from Canon
Reviews.Author: gbdusmc
Reviews.Content: It has a solid feel and can handle at least a 16GB card.  The price paid on Amazon was the best I could find.Pros:The pictures are greatNice large display on the back of the camera helps to ensure good shots.The camera is easy to use.Cons:This camera does not ship with a memory card.The auto focus sometimes is a little slow to adjust but eventually works well.Overall a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: Budget Canon Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: D. Hentze
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 is a low cost, no-frills, budget point and shoot camera, with a rather long range lens. The camera originally sold for between $129-$169 dollars, and got mediocre reviews. Recently the price dropped to $79.95, which makes it a real bargain. Canon has cut some corners with the ELPH 115 though. You don't get a USB cable. The screen is only 2.7", and has a modest 230K resolution. The settings are pretty limited, but you get some different shooting modes. Auto mode works well under most conditions. Picture quality outdoors is pretty good for a tiny sensor camera. Picture quality indoors is not so good. The flash is weak, and anything above ISO 200 produces noisy results. The 720p video is good. Refresh time between shots is a little slow. Battery life is average. I got about 150 shots before I needed to recharge. By far the best part of the Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 is the wide angle 8X zoom lens. A few years ago, a lens with this range wasn't available in a tiny point and shoot camera at any cost. The Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 is far from a perfect camera, but as one of the cheapest point and shoot cameras out there. It's very good for the price. For $20 more though, you can get the Canon PowerShot ELPH 130. It's the same camera, but adds a better screen and WiFi. I give Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 "4 Stars" for having a big lens and small price tag.Pros:Price.Wide Angle 8X Zoom Lens.Good results in good lighting.Good Auto Mode.Good Image Stabilization.Small size.Cons:USB Cable not included.No internal memory or SD Card included.Print manual not included.Fair-poor results in low lighting.Low resolution screen.Limited user settings.Buttons might be too small for some.

Reviews.Title: Power shot
Reviews.Author: Madeline Dunn
Reviews.Content: Had a Canon before, liked the simplicity of using it.  Finally didn't work right so bought another Canon.  Still like it, does everything I need and can fit in my pocket when I"m not carrying a purse.  Pixels are higher so my pictures do come out clearer and sharper.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Step
Reviews.Content: To be truthful I'm actually a little disappointed with this camera. As others have mentioned it seems to have a hard time focusing. Many of the photos I've taken are just not crisp, they seem out of focus and slightly blurry. The colors aren't very accurate either. On the up side, it preforms well in low light conditions and is easy to carry. However, I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Carol M. "grandma"
Reviews.Content: Canon cameras are the best camera for me since I use it daily at work. It fits in my pocket and I must have dropped my first Canon at least a thousand times before I broke it.

Reviews.Title: It's okay...
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I had the older version of this camera for 6 years before I broke it. I like the older version better. With this camera, it's really easy to take blurry pictures. To delete a picture, you have to click about 4 buttons. I used it over a weekend & the battery died 1/2 way through. I'm not sure if that was a fluke because it was the first time using it, or if the battery actually doesn't last that long. The pictures look really good if they aren't blurry though. All in all, it's okay.

Reviews.Title: This camera is THE BEST
Reviews.Author: Lady
Reviews.Content: This is the second Canon PowerShot I have purchased. The qualify of the photos is superior, the zoom capability is amazing, and the convenient size enables it to fit into purse, pocket or palm.  A great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Meghan
Reviews.Content: Camera was way smaller than I was expecting, which is a pleasant surprise, as girl pockets are either tiny or nonexistent.  The only thing about the camera is the picture looks grainy when taking pictures. The pictures themselves look great though, so I did not give it a lower rating.  Great beginner camera, easy to use and figure out.  I bought the camera cord with it to download the pictures straight to my Mac, but it did not automatically open the camera's folder like I was expecting. Tried looking for software and couldn't find any for Mac... used the cord in Windows PC and worked exactly like I thought it would.

Reviews.Title: Great for taking close up Pics with the Macro Mode setting.
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: I love my Elph camera. I needed a camera that has Macro mode and anti shake that work at the same time and I found it in this camera. I highly recommend this great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: SF Jan
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good.  Camera is small, light weight and easy to use.  My only frustration was that it did not come with the cord to off load the photos to the computer.  Luckily I had one from my previous camera.  This camera is a good value for the price for sure.  I also like the power of the zoom feature.  Very valuable.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Roger Tansley
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use. I like it very much and would recommend it to anyone who wants an easy to use camera

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Coopersmith
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Easy to use, has a really great zoom, and I truly love it.  I have yet to read any directions, but have taken about 100 pictures and downloaded them on my computer (I take out the memory card and stick it in the port on the side of my laptop).  Photos are great.  Much, much, much better than iPhone photos.

Reviews.Title: Elph 115
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Good little camera-I miss the focus window that allows one to look at what you're shooting rather than the screen.  Screen focus can be, depending on the light conditions, a little tricky.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera.
Reviews.Author: GeoDov
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 80 year old mother. It was very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Better not forget to order a Scan Disk
Reviews.Author: Karin
Reviews.Content: It sure doesn't come with anything.  It's very tiny.  It will suit my purposes as I just want to take some pictures.  The battery charger is larger than the camera.  That could be good or bad.  Since I shoved it in my purse, it probably was a good thing for me. It fits nicely.  I've taken a couple of videos.  It doesn't respond as quickly as I'd like for snapshots, but not bad.  For the price though, it's going to be quite useful.  But if you're serious at all about your pictures, you might want to upgrade.  It doesn't come with a cable for downloading on the computer nor a scan disk.  I don't know if adding all that in makes it more expensive than some models that do.  I had a time getting the battery door open and inserting the batter AND the scan disk.  You have to do it just right...and not force too hard.  It took me a little while to get that all sorted out to where it would finally close back up.  Seems like they could have given you a better battery door.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: DH12
Reviews.Content: I was shopping in Amazon for a Lumix DMC-LX7 and I stumbled upon this Little camera FOR LESS THAN $80! I thought "why not?".  It arrived on Christmas Eve, so I charged the battery (less than 3 hrs) and gave it to my two year old granddaughter.  She LOVED it.  While the menus may not be intuitive, the user interface - automatic focus and exposure make it possible for a two year old to use it, and to take some pretty good photos.  EVERYONE wants to pose for a two year old photographer.  Pretty fun,When she's not using it,  I  carry it around in my pocket.  I know that there is the potential for getting a stuck lens, but for <$80, I'm willing to take that chance. If you don't have a camera with you, you just don't get the shots you want.  My wife likes to borrow it because it takes much better pictures than her iPhone.Image quality is good (maybe not as good as a Leica, but pretty good!). I like Canon's warm flesh tones, it eliminates my desire to color correct every shot.LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: BJ LAHOVICH
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and size makes it easy to carry. Takes great pictures! Like that it was available in pink!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Elph 16MP Digital Camera.
Reviews.Author: Harley H.
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small compact, easy to use, quality Digital Camera to carry with me on trips. This camera is loaded with features one would think comes in much higher priced camera's. You can customize your pictures or let the camera do all the settings. It will automatically frame a portrait photo, so you don't have to do anything more than aim and click. You can also make sound video's with this camera. It does it all and with a great reputation for quality products, you cant miss. I highly recommend this Digital Camera for the amateur to the professional photographer.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ed Deppe
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price. Cheap enough to almost be "disposable" - not so expensive compared to a brand like "Leica", but very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: liz
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. I love the size and the quality of the pictures. Its good to take anywhere easy fit in your purse.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Great Price!!
Reviews.Author: David Hatten
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a few days ago, took great macro shots in the garden outback, then went to the ocean this weekend and took great pictures at Santa Cruz.  It didn't come with detailed instructions on what all the settings mean so just have to play around with them.  Great camera, not one complaint.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: G. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I needed something reasonably-priced to take pictures of jewelry for my business.  So far, it's been one of my best purchase decisions!  My favorite features are the automatic micro-focus and the anti-shake features which are great for shooting small earrings.  Together they pick up all the details and I don't need a tripod.  I also like the white balance feature because it allows me to take photos indoors without worrying about the "orange glow" that's so prominent under incandescent lighting.  I really don't have any complaints so far.  Surprisingly, I'm pretty thrilled!

Reviews.Title: I bought it for the size.
Reviews.Author: Frank Clark
Reviews.Content: This camera is light weight and small.  Thus it's just great for traveling.  You will get better the more you use it.  Battery life is fine but get an extra one.  It seems a little slow in storing images, but that might be because of the storage card.  All in all, I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Greatl little camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Zanda
Reviews.Content: Compact, easy to carry around, takes great photos and short videos. Replaces one my husband lost in the lake because he didn't have the strap around his wrist!

Reviews.Title: LIGHTWEIGHT
Reviews.Author: JANE MCD
Reviews.Content: Great zoom!  Drawback is that like other digital cameras the viewing screen is not very good in bright sunlight. I would recommend this camera .

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: brier
Reviews.Content: Works great & the more I use it the more I find it will do. If I do my part pictures are clear & focused,

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power Shot from Amazon
Reviews.Author: chuck behal
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good. The instruction's are clear and very easy to follow. Downloading picture's very easy also getting print's was easy.

Reviews.Title: East to Use pocket camera
Reviews.Author: William G. Faust
Reviews.Content: This is the third in a line of Cannon cameras that have served us well.  We are point and shoot people. Good zoom; good stability; like the fact that the video functions is now clearly separated from the individual picture slide switch.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 is wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Peterson
Reviews.Content: Once again, these Power Shot cameras prove how wonderful they are!  I had my original PowerShot stolen in Venice earlier in the spring so needed a new one.  It takes wonderful pictures, sharp and clear.  I make glass beads and needed a camera to take macro shots and this one has been doing the job for me.I also got this one wet right after I got it.  So I took out the battery, picture card and put the camera in rice for a week.  We couldn't believe it but it still works perfectly!  So, needless to say, I am a big fan of Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 cameras!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bodega chef
Reviews.Content: I have been using a large camera with a viewfinder for years but wanted a little point and shoot as well.  The Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 takes photos that are every bit as good as my big bulky camera and the whole thing, including the mini-tripod fits in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase
Reviews.Author: Wings71
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  I'm a first time digital camera buyer and wanted something with great photo capability and very easy to use.  This has both.  I'm truly impressed.  Love the stablizer as I've borrowed others cameras before and ended up with a lot of blurry photos.  Crystal clear pictures and a snap to operate.  Video is good quality and easy to do too. I got it in blue and really love the color.  Something different

Reviews.Title: Great performance!
Reviews.Author: Would purchase again!
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  Took to Italy on vacation and it performed great.  Size is just right for pockets and having the battery charger was great and saved looking for batteries, which are expensive in Europe!  It's exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: PRIVACY ISSUE - Caution if posting anything to the web
Reviews.Author: user_932842
Reviews.Content: while this camera works great, you should be aware that this model of camera records the serial number in the exif data which cannot be turned off. This may not seem like a big deal except when you consider that every image is linked together by the serial number and there are sites designed to search the web for any pictures based on the serial number in the exif data. So users should be highly aware of this privacy concern. Canon has no intention to patch the firmware to fix this issue.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera: Bad Battery Door
Reviews.Author: Joel Bremson "joel3000"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little pocket or purse camera. It takes a nice picture in a wide variety of conditions and has a rechargeable battery, which is what I was after.Unfortunately, within the first days of use it stopped correctly seating the battery causing the battery door not to close correctly and the camera not to work. I tried getting a new battery for it thinking that the original battery may have swelled, which happens with rechargeable batteries. The new battery did not help, the battery door still does not close.UPDATE:The camera was still under its one year OEM warranty. They took it back and replaced it. I did however have to pay for shipping to their repair site.

Reviews.Title: Glad I bought it!
Reviews.Author: B. Rogers
Reviews.Content: I guess the only drawback I can think of it doesn't take batteries. It comes with a charger.Takes great pictures!when you click the shutter, it takes the picture, no lag time.  A little slow under dark conditions.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Camera ELPH115IS
Reviews.Author: Marlene
Reviews.Content: I am impressed by Canon camera's and wanted a light weight camera.  It takes great pictures, I ordered it on Dec 16, 2013 for myself.  So far it has preformed great.  However, when I removed the SD card then reinserted it, the card would not lock in and I couldn't close the cover where the battery and card are located.  I am presently sending the camera out for repairs.  It is suppose to be under warranty. I think I would of purchased two or three models up from this model.

Reviews.Title: Old models were better
Reviews.Author: Accidental Hipster
Reviews.Content: Not as good as previous models. This was my fourth Canon  ELF camera. Works fine if the lighting is just right. Early models had a large range of adjustments to correct for any conditions. Fully zoomed the picture quality is poor.

Reviews.Title: You cannot get a better camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: gilamnstr
Reviews.Content: I would love an SLR, but they're too  big. This is my 3rd one, I break them often because I take my camera everywhere, climbing, mtn biking, snowboarding, canyoneering etc.  The last one I had fell in the river with me when I was flyfishing, and it still went on for another 8 months.A long exposure time for night shots is all I really want in addition to existing features.

Reviews.Title: 9 year old son loves it
Reviews.Author: Mark Hamilton
Reviews.Content: It's a nice little camera.  I bought the blue one, too.  The pictures come-out clear, as well as the videos.  It has an optical zoom lens, fits in a tiny bag, and my 9 year old(s) love it.  The battery/memory card slot area is well designed (close the cover when the card or battery is out!).  There's a little button to keep the battery from sliding-out on its own when you open the cover.  The SDHC card does the usual push in to pop-out, and clicks back in.  I think these are easy to manage, and take good pictures, even for my kids.  I really like the little rechargeable battery and the charger that came with it.  They are well-made and the batteries click-in to both camera and charger nicely.  This is pushing the kids' responsibility level up a notch (wife thought I was crazy, but so far, so good).  They have to charge their batteries, copy their photos and movies to the computer, keep their 16GB cards from overflowing, and not break them.  I bought warranties for both.  I never buy those.  This time I did.  Just a matter of time.

Reviews.Title: Decent quality at a decent price
Reviews.Author: Donna Hahn
Reviews.Content: Bought it for daughter to take on an out-of-state field trip. It is small and has pretty good zoom. Outside static pictures look great. Inside is very good, expect flash seems to drop off beyond 15', then the picture darkens a considerably. Biggest limitation (as with most point-and-shoot cameras of this class) is that it does a poor job of catching anything in motion. If it's moving, then your going to get at least some level of blurring. If you plan to use it for posed shots or static scenery shots, then it will work very well with good picture resolution and a respectable optical zoom. If you want to catch your kids in motion, dancing, sports...then you are probably going to have to step up to the SLR-type digitals (I like my Nikon for that).

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Linda Hale-Stuivenvolt
Reviews.Content: I love the look of this camera as well as the pictures I take with it! They come out nice and clear, even if the subject was moving a little.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price.
Reviews.Author: Delana Patnode
Reviews.Content: Wow have the prices of camera's come down the last few years.  Not a ton of features, but great little camera with Canon's excellent build quality.  For the price, very happy.

Reviews.Title: Compact . . . Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: If you want a camera that is easy to operate and very compact, I would highly recommend this one! It even fits in your pocket!

Reviews.Title: The camera user's manual should be included.
Reviews.Author: sung jung
Reviews.Content: The camera itself seems to be o.k for the price,  but when I try to get the user manual through internet as instructed in the deliveredpackage, the website is very difficult or impossible  to find the camera model and  when I clicked the "DOWNLOADS" key , it won't down load. The canon camera website should list all of the models they are selling  and the manual should be easily down loaed.

Reviews.Title: Small but lacking
Reviews.Author: GeekSlayer
Reviews.Content: I am looking for a small camera for an upcoming trip. The size of the camera is perfect however, the image quality and poor at best. The sample image on Cannon's website for this camera is in no way from this camera. The images are grainy and the low lighting is extremely poor as well.Honestly I did a side by side photo comparison on a 5.2 Mega Pixel Sony Cyber shot and this camera and the Sony wins hands down. I would spend a few more dollars and look at the ELPH 130 or consider a different camera. I am sending this one back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: ysugar
Reviews.Content: this camera is excellent for on the go, and is pretty good for a point and shoot in regards to quality and ease of use. if you are looking for a little more, I would recommend going with the canon s110 its probably the best point and shoot out there, however except to pay at least double the price of this one.

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price
Reviews.Author: D. Clark
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my wife who takes tons of pictures and needed to replace her failing sony camera similar to this one that she keeps with her 24/7.  We went with Canon because it's overall the best. We have a Canon Digital SLR with add on lenses and flashes and absolutely love it.  Canon rocks!This particular (ELPH 115) camera though we were not so happy with.  Unless you held the camera completely still and the person or object were completely still, the picture always turned out blurry.  Unsure if there was a problem with the Image Stablization (IS) or if the camera itself was not as good as we expected.  We tested with IS on and off and it didn't seem to make a difference with blurry pictures.Amazon was GREAT with the return process.  Emailed a prepaid UPS return label and issued a full credit.  Once my wife's Sony camera failes completely we will probably go to a local store to get a hands on test of some different model cameras and then order online again.  I still plan to go with a Canon model but I'll be sure she's happy with the picture quality before making a purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very compact and nice camera
Reviews.Author: Vanessa
Reviews.Content: I bought this small point and shoot camera to help me reach my goal for 2014- take a photo every day this year and document them in a photo album. So far- I love it. The quality of the photos once I put them on my computer are about what I expected- not as great as my husbands DSLR but better than that of my iPhone. Its so small and compact that its easy for me to fit in my purse (or pocket) and take everywhere which will be exactly what I need to accomplish my 365 pictures goal.

Reviews.Title: Takes Good Clear Pictures
Reviews.Author: Barbie
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use once you read the online Canon manual. I'm still getting to know how it works, but so far I'm impressed!

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Simon
Reviews.Content: Quick and easy camera to use.  Would of gave five stars however there is zero internal memory so you need a SD Card right away before using it.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Sparrow
Reviews.Content: I wanted something to carry in my purse that takes good pictures and this is the perfect camera. It takes great pictures for the price.I'm satisfied. Also I like the fact that you can recharge it and not have to buy batteries for it.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera for traveling
Reviews.Author: Richard M. Tilker
Reviews.Content: This camera is very efficient for its size. Good zoom lens, easy to carry with you. Takes very good shots, easy to down load to your computer

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: Sonia Streeter
Reviews.Content: its what i expected very light weight, the only thing i dont like is the long delay time between pictures and when loading pictures to view them and i do not like the fuzziness of the screen, but all together a decent camera for the price

Reviews.Title: Clear pictures easy to use.
Reviews.Author: candace pope
Reviews.Content: Took it to Hawaii have great clear pictures. Easy to operate and light to carry fits in my small purse.

Reviews.Title: Exelent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Cox
Reviews.Content: Had an older version of the Power Shot and this one is much faster and more reliable!(three more words)

Reviews.Title: almost perfect...
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: The Canon Power Shot ELPH 115 is an awesome little camera...and the little part is wonderful!  It takes fantastic pictures and videos.  It has so many other features....I just wish the instruction booklet helped you on these features!  There is little to none when it comes to all of these special features.  I have tried to play around with them, but it's not easy to learn by trial and error....I would rather have an instruction booklet that tells me in detail how to use them and how to get back out of the feature.  BUT, I do love this camera with only using the auto feature...it took someone else to show me how to use the zoom after several long range shots...and it was as simple as a little tab up by the click and shoot button.  But when your vision is not perfect...I could not even see the tiny picture of the big tree and lil tree to show you it was the zoom.  LOL .  If I had a book that I could sit down and read about ALL of the features with my glasses, then I would know about all of these things, and how to use them...If the instruction booklet was improved greatly, then I would for sure be rating this a 5 STAR!!

Reviews.Title: pocket size
Reviews.Author: artistbob
Reviews.Content: I really like the size of this camera.  it fits easily into my pocket.  The zoom has  a good digital extension for usae on bright sunny days.  The quality of the photos is good but not as good as the larger, PowerShot SX260HS.  I got it because of it's easy portability.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work right with moving subjects
Reviews.Author: J&KN; in NC "kathyn"
Reviews.Content: Loved the size and the color options and thought I'd found the perfect "point and shoot" camera.  However, the facial recognition feature just did not work right.  Many times it "recognized" something other than a face and I couldn't get it to focus on the actual face.  Then I couldn't figure out how to disable the facial recognition feature, and decided that couldn't be done.  The camera would always say it was "working" and would take several seconds before it actually took a picture.  When the subject was moving, this usually resulted in a blurred picture.  Still pictures usually turned out OK, but I don't think the camera did all that well with indoor lighting.  Full sun or clouds outside worked well, but the camera just didn't seem to like low-lighting conditions.  Was very disappointed with this camera and returned it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, but has drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Jeanne E. Evans "Bead Designer"
Reviews.Content: This is a lightweight, compact unit....BUT 1) The buttons on the back get pushed in too easily when I'm attempting to take a photo...and all of a sudden, I'm filming a movie! 2) C'mon, Cannon! You have great products, but there are 'Accessories" one must buy before being able to use the camera! Put a few more items in your 'Accessories" listing...like the Owner's Manual, the Flash Memory Card choices, card reader, etc.My old Canon used a different memory card and reader, but I was able to use the gadget that links the camera to my hub on the computer.All in all, happy with the purchase and Canon's service.

Reviews.Title: Love this pink camera
Reviews.Author: Laura Shaw
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so I could take it to ball games and other events and slip it in my pocket or purse. I love it, it serves this function well. The rechargeable battery lasts a long time, the picture quality is very good considering its small size. It is a second slow when using the flash but still a very good buy.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!!!
Reviews.Author: Joseph McDanold
Reviews.Content: Bought for my wife for Christmas, she loves it. Camera is very easy to use, auto setting does its job just fine. For the price I don't think you can buy a better or smaller camera. The camera does not come with a memory card, but I purchased one with the camera on Amazon so no big deal. I also printed out the owners manual for free at Cannons website, also no big deal. If you read the owners manual you will be surprised at the capabilities of this small camera. I stress small because when I was researching cameras I read the reviews for this one and was confused by the reviewers comparing this camera to high end DSLR's. My thought on this is get real people, if you need a $900 camera buy a $900 camera. I also read a lot of reviews talking about how the previous model was better, this may very well be true. Bottom line is maybe the previous model of this camera was better, I don't know never had that one, and obviously a more expensive camera is going to (in most cases) perform better, but for the price of this one you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy!
Reviews.Author: Melisa K Goodman
Reviews.Content: Got it for my daughter Hannah for Christmas!  She's a natural and loves the color.  I love the picture quality.  Can't go wrong with a Canon! :OP

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: jimstur
Reviews.Content: I've been a digital camera owner for many years and this is the best for your money small camera. The "auto" mode is very impressive. The best camera in the world won't do you any good of it's at home, so the fact that this fits right in my pocket makes it the best camera for me.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: GLADYS AMATO
Reviews.Content: Nice camera takes nice pictures, we have bought this brand before.  would recommend it  to use for everyday pics, nice

Reviews.Title: awesome litte camera
Reviews.Author: granny
Reviews.Content: Very happy to have this little camera which takes nice photos. Bought this in the last month. Small size to fit into purse or pocket

Reviews.Title: Simple and great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Kim Kopf
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful pictures. It is super simple to use.  I'm one to not like to fumble around with complicated settings, so this is perfect for me. I always keep it in my purse, as it takes sooo much better photos than the cell phone.

Reviews.Title: my mom loves it!
Reviews.Author: Dhoris
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom and I bought it because the design was simple and straight to the point. It wasn't too complicated and easy for her to navigate through. The only thing I didn't like was that it did not come with a USB to connect to the computer. But she doesn't need that because she likes to get her photos printed so she just takes her camera to a store that will develope her photos. She LOVES it!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: I can carry this in my pants pocket which makes it a very handy device. Bought it mainly to take as a backup for mybigger camera on a vacation to Europe recently made. I used it as much as the the bigger camera. Pictures are just asgood too!

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Peter Isaacson
Reviews.Content: It is an amazing camera...and I would have given it an A+. The problem is, it comes without a memory card or download cable.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures,easy to use and fits in a shirt pocket
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera on a trip to the Canadian Yukon, a float plane trip over the Misty Fjord area and on a recent flight in a glider. The pictures that I took  were great and the fact that it fits in a shirt pocket makes it simple to carry and quickly use in an atmosphere that is rapidly changing.

Reviews.Title: Parts was missing from box
Reviews.Author: james mays
Reviews.Content: Parts was missing from box.  no interface cable, no AV cable, no Getting started guide, no Solution disk. Camera is great parts missing

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ashley Nesheim
Reviews.Content: The camera is nice, however I expected crisper shots with less blur. It is also not very user friendly, if I adjust the settings the way I want them, for some reason it seems to zoom in more than if I use the preset settings. It has a battery and charger, so you won't have to buy a bunch of batteries, but that also means you can't use it while the battery is charging unless you buy a a second one. I mostly use it to take pictures for eBay, usually it takes clear pics whether close up or far away. However, it does tell me I'm not holding still enough most of the time, and occasionally I get blurred pictures, even when I try to hold still. It works well for what I use it for, but if you are used to a more high tech camera, or you are using it for motion shots (like for kids or pets), you may want to consider a slightly higher priced alternative.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: Chih Ming Chen
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, small and light to carry.photo quality is excellence!camera appearance is cute too, I love it

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: Hope Russell "HopeR"
Reviews.Content: The options are standard for point & shoot camera. The megapixels are great. If you have steady hands this would likely be a great camera for you.It would have been a great camera, but the stability option didn't compensate for my shaky hands nearly enough. All the photos are blurry from camera shake. I wasn't expecting this much problem because I usually use a DSLR camera. I think the weight of a big camera, plus better stability options compensates for my problem with the DSLR. As it is, I gave this camera away because it was useless for me.

Reviews.Title: Froze up after 6 months
Reviews.Author: Mom 24
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my old Canon Powershot SD1200. it was stolen and I was so disappointed. That camera lasted me 5 years and 4 kids. I wanted one that was similar in size so it could fit in my pocket. This seemed perfect. 1st problem, the old Canon had an auto setting that was "kids & pets." It was perfect for getting action shots at sporting events that weren't blurry. This camera has no such setting. I really never used any other setting on my old one. The pictures were clear and color was great. But after 6 months, I tried to use it and the whole screen froze up. I had to take out the battery a few times to get it to even retract the lens back into the camera! Now it is nothing but trouble. It works only half the time and the other half I am messing with it to get it to unfreeze and taking the battery out to get it to reset. I know it wasn't that expensive, but compared to my old one which lasted even after I dropped it a few times, this one is crap.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: It is easy to handle. I love the lens. I like the color too. I have no complaints about this camera.

Reviews.Title: not completely satisfied
Reviews.Author: Lori Weckler
Reviews.Content: It did not come with a USB cord. The system would only let me order 1 I needed 2. The memory card is fine.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen Robinson
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Compact design makes it easy to put in pocket. Takes very clear vieos and pictures.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Kimmai D.
Reviews.Content: uncle bought these for our family out of the USA. works and looks great so everyone is a happy camper

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Khemraj
Reviews.Content: could not believe the price for this 16MP camera. it is truly a great deal given all the features the camera has.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol Gustason-Johnson
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice size to take with you.  Takes great pictures and is easy to use.  I love the pink color too!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot ElPh 115 16MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: YVONNE MACKEY
Reviews.Content: My daughter really like her cameral, she's been asking for one for sometime, her favorite color is blue and the handling of the camera is easy for her.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Harold O. Walker
Reviews.Content: takes good pictures and is easy to use. Missing a site glass that I do use outside when the sun glares on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Mekokome
Reviews.Content: A great little camera. Easy to use and takes great pictures. I would recommend cannon cameras to anyone wanting an easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: It was a great camera for the first month
Reviews.Author: Peggy Wheaton "Peggy W"
Reviews.Content: It was a great camera for the first month. the second moth the battery would not hold a charge. I decided I didn't want to spend $25.00 for a replacement battery just to learn it was something else wrong.

Reviews.Title: Was not impressed at all.
Reviews.Author: Lauren Fielding
Reviews.Content: I heard amazing things about the Canon PowerShot but it was slow and had very bad quality at night and with anything in motion. Pictures are good with good light but still unimpressive. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures from a small camera!
Reviews.Author: S. D. Jones
Reviews.Content: Cannon hits another home run! I can carry it in my pocket and slip it out to catch a picture!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera that takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: Rick Grunwald
Reviews.Content: My old kodak bit the dust and I needed a reasonable point and shoot camera. I saw this one and bought it. It does a remarkable job with most of the pictures I have taken. The port where the cable attaches is a bit cheesy but other than that, I like it. The battery charge lasts a long time It is not self explanatory from the description, but you must buy a cable separatelyFrom the Canon web page, this is what is in the boxPowerShot ELPH 115 ISWrist Strap WS-800Battery Pack NB-11LBattery Charger CB-2LHere is a link to the cablehttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0045RUZGI/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i02?ie=UTF8&psc;=1

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Andrew McDowell
Reviews.Content: I grabbed this as a camera, small enough to use in my pack while I was overseas in Afghanistan. Has not failed me and seems to fair well over the dirt and dust I put it though

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Hawaii Biker
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to haul around with my motorcycle.  I did not want to take my good camera with me.  The price of this one was right.The camera takes outstanding still pictures.  They are very sharp, and the colors are saturated and true.  There is very little pixelation with enlargement of the pictures.  The video seems darker than the still pictures when taken at the same time.  The plus of the video is that one can use the telephoto feature while shooting the video.  It is very easy to change from automatic to manual mode with the click of one switch.I had asked others before my purchase whether the body is plastic or metal and was advised that it is metal.  I was disappointed to discover that it is plastic.All-in-all, this is an excellent, ease-to-use, inexpensive camera.  Only time will tell how it holds up riding around in my motorcycle saddlebags.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: wilma kruger
Reviews.Content: I enjoy using my camera.  It is simple to use and small enough I can put it in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera At An Amazing Price!
Reviews.Author: Thomas L.
Reviews.Content: I've had Canon Powershots for years and have always trusted their photo quality and ease of use. I needed a replacement before a vacation, and this was the right price and features I needed. The deep blue color is attractive as well. This is great for snapping beautiful pictures in a variety of situations.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Rodney Sandt
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I was looking for.  The size is perfect.  The pictures are terrific.  It has to be the easiest camera to use.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: mitchell Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: compact and very easy to set up and use. lightweight and case clips to belt loop very securely.The 8 power zoom really brings things in close.

Reviews.Title: Quality of camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Pope
Reviews.Content: I don't know how I feel about this camera yet. I haven't printed any of the pictures yet, but I have had trouble figuring out how to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Canon Camera.
Reviews.Author: Edwina M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. I like the color and the beautiful photos the camera takes. I will recommend this camera to my family.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Charles A.
Reviews.Content: Smaller than expected, but works great and takes really good pictures.Easy to use and battery is easy to install, but have to make sure its turned the right way.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera
Reviews.Author: leakuntz44
Reviews.Content: Takes great photos. Clear and easy to use. Just wish the information was a little more detailed on camera. Wanted to use it on my trip and am very familiar with it now,

Reviews.Title: works
Reviews.Author: Domer
Reviews.Content: works just fine no problems with it battery stays charged for a good amount of time. pictures come out great

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy Graber
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely easy to use and takes great photos, including video.  I love the compact size. I was always a Kodak purchaser but am very happy with the Canon ELPH.

Reviews.Title: La vie en bleu
Reviews.Author: Vero
Reviews.Content: I have just received this camera and at the moment I have not enough information to be able to write about it. I wanted anothercompact to replace my old one I loved so much. All I can say about this one is that the colors seem to be more saturated than they used to. I like the lighter weight and blue color of this camera; it even seems smaller than my old pocket size one. However, I think the case and buttons look cheaper...but sincerely, it is incredible to get a new camera at such a price!I will write a little bit more about this camera once i am more familiar with it .

Reviews.Title: Newest version to my ELPH cameras
Reviews.Author: Joan Hanna
Reviews.Content: As a Director of a Preschool where 3 and 4 year olds are our population, the ELPH 115 is great!  I have 2 others of a previous generation and all are performing amazingly well!  I'm going on a short trip in two weeks and will take the 115 with me as I enjoy some away with nature time!  It is easy to pack in purse or day-pack and super easy to use with great results!

Reviews.Title: It's ok for the price...
Reviews.Author: Mama of 4
Reviews.Content: I got this for about $69. It's ok for the price, but I wish I had spent a little more and got a better camera. It tends to blur alot of pics, I get red eyes alot even with everything set in order to not get red eye. It does the job as far as I really needed something to use other than my iphone camera all the time, as this is very small and lightweight, easy to put into my purse even in the case. I have a huge canon that I just cannot lug around everywhere all of the time. So that's why I really wanted to go with something lighter in weight and easy to grab on the go for when I need it. And I also really wanted something that worked fantastic in low light as I need something like that for school functions with my kids when we are in the auditorium. But I just cannot get this to work very well in low light whatsoever. Perhaps I'm not setting a function correctly, but I have tried everything I can think of and cannot get it to work in low light very well at all. It's very frustrating.I can't say I'd purchase this again. But for now, it works for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Love!
Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: Perfect size, great picture, easy to use, love the color. This is my second PowerShot ELPH and it does everything I need it to.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for price
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice, inexpensive camera. Brought it before my daughter was born & found it was super easy to use. Pictures are of decent quality

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased With This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Julie K. Nichols
Reviews.Content: I have a very old Canon Powershot that I have been using for years.....I sell antiques online and needed a new camera to take the place of my old Canon.  When this came up on sale, I could not pass it up.  With 16mp, I said to myself, GET THIS!!!  My old Canon only had 3.2mp and yet it still gave me great photos.  Now with this new blue beauty...WOW!!! My photos look amazing.  The settings are easy to figure out and the quality is great.  I am so glad I went ahead and bought this camera!  Love it.  You can't go wrong with Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP DC
Reviews.Author: Craterz
Reviews.Content: Personally, I purchased this point & shoot camera mainly because it uses the same memory card as my DSLR (Canon T3i, or 600D, depending on what country you're from). I wanted a new "work" point & shoot (aka P&S;) camera that I could easily get the pictures off of it without the hassle of carrying around some special cable for. At around $80, this really fit the bill.I have yet to take this P&S; camera on a project with me, although I have several international projects coming up soon this summer put it to a real test, the meager testing I have done with it so far, this camera is exceeding my expectations. It takes great pictures in very low light conditions! I'm actually surprised how good the pics come out. Of course, it doesn't compare to my T3i with the right lens on it, but for a P&S; camera that costs under $100, I am honestly surprised. My DSLR setup is peaking around $4000, which is my "goto" camera for my international amateur photography travel pictures. Having said that, I really want to know how well it does when there is a bright source of light in one small area and the rest of the scene is actually very dark. I won't know until my next project. Just try to take pictures of cutting steel via a flame cutting torch with anything other than an expensive DSLR, it's really not so easy. And everyone in my industry carries around thousands of dollars of photography equipment around just waiting to get damaged by the actual process. Yeah, not going to happen. If a camera that costs less than $100 can get the job done, then if it gets damaged... well... no big deal.Anyway. My previous "work" P&S; camera was a Sony, and had a memory card that could not be inserted into most laptops. Especially any newer ones. I always had to carry around a special cable just to get the pics off the thing. This was a real pain in the arse. And when you travel internationally as much I do, the less junk you can carry the better you can pack for the trip.There is a chance I might be reimbursed by my company for this purchase, but even if my company decides not to reimburse the $80 I'm out of pocket for this P&S; camera, it will not break the bank (plus an additional $12 for a 16G SD card).This P&S; camera fits my needs so far. A memory card that will work in my DSLR, as well as this P&S.; Also can be inserted into almost any laptop. When I have the opportunity to take it on an actual job, I will add to my opinion of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is just the right size to slip in a small clutch purse or a pocket. My only complaint is that there was no adjustment bead on the strap. My husband's old one did. It makes it much safer to be able to secure it to your wrist while taking pictures from the back of the motorcycle.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Brigid
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Canon and have purchased many of their products in the past. I currently own the Canon PowerShot SX510 (which is amazing), but I wanted a small camera that I can carry in a wristlet, purse, or even pocket for impromptu shots. This camera is the perfect solution! It's compact and colorful, but it still takes amazing, high quality pictures and has a lot of features. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Pebbles
Reviews.Content: Tiny enough to slip in a pocket, takes some amazing shots.  Very happy with this camera, it takes good zoom shots when needed.

Reviews.Title: nice and small
Reviews.Author: barbi S "Barbi"
Reviews.Content: There were times when it was windy and the camera took great pics. Colors are so vivid. Love this little camera. Fits into my small purse without taking too much room.Highly recommend for a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Smaller Camera
Reviews.Author: emuk17
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I wanted a smaller camera that took great photos, and this one sure does! The zoom is very nice!

Reviews.Title: Yes!
Reviews.Author: Danielle Hammond
Reviews.Content: This is my replacement for an older model that was stolen a couple years ago. I love it. And prices are much cheaper than when I bought my old one! :)

Reviews.Title: Easy, portable, good pics
Reviews.Author: NB
Reviews.Content: The size is nice to fit even in small purses.  It isn't too complicated and the pictures turn out nicely.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: pvc
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughters first trip to europe. She just loves the automatic function, it works well and saves time for amateur users. It's small so she can carry it anywhere. It takes very nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot!
Reviews.Author: Nickie S
Reviews.Content: Got a great holiday deal on this little camera.  Yes, I know we all have phone now that take pictures but if you want clear and crisp images you still need something other than a cell phone.  I haven"t managed to take the leap to a DSLR camera yet mainly because I don't take that many pictures and I don't want to carry another bag that could be big and bulky. Okay, and I don't want something that has an overabundance of features to the point where I would need lessons (maybe I can make the leap when I retire).  This camera is very small, lightweight and easy to carry aound in a very small case.  It takes wonderfully clear pictures and I really like the ease of it.  I am impressed with the battery life as well.  I am very pleased with it and for the price it was even better.  I like this much better than the old Casio that I had which I paid a lot more for.

Reviews.Title: Canon or bust!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: I got my camera and took it to the park to practice with it and I love it!  The pics are crystal clear, awesome macro pics, perfect landscapes.  I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: love my 115 powershot
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: love it just like my old one, i love canons too bad they didnt have red, but its still a great camera, takes great photos oh my vary active 16 month old son :)

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: The Canon ELPH series constitutes light-weight, fun cameras, available in many colors, and focused on convenience. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The ELPH110 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 16.1 resolution (megapixels), and a x8 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CCD-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.If you were to, say, take pictures of friends and family at an outdoor gathering, this camera is what you need. If you get ambitious, there will be stumbling blocks. Here is the camera's trait mix: It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 1600. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 230,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The burst rate is a reasonable 2.9 frames per second- great for quick shots. The weight of the camera is a convenient 133 grams.Overall, nice, fun camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at one h@ll of a price.

Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with  my Elph115. Great pocket camera for the money, good for travel and for work.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Goodman
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP Digital Camera from Best Buy. I paid $89.99 at Best Buy. I love this camera. I can take good pictures, record clear HD videos (record up to 20 minutes or more. Depending on which SD Memory Card), and I can zoom the scene 8x with the optical zoom to take a close up picture. When the battery go dead, all I have to do is recharge the battery, This is the best digital camera ever. The camera have a speaker for you to listen to the sounds after you record a video and review it. The last digital camera I had was the Kodak Easyshare C180. I had that camera for 3 years. I had to get away from the Kodak Easyshare C180 because the pictures would always come out dark (picture quality was terrible), the video came out blur after recording a video and converting it from the MOV to AVI on a computer, it didn't have a speaker on the camera when you get ready to review the video, the optical zoom was only 3x, and I have to always keep buying AA batteries to stock up.And, the first digital camera I had was a Polaroid a530 Digital Camera back in 2009. In 2010, the Polaroid Digital Camera had fell and dropped to the floor so hard (ceramic tile) that it had cracked the screen and broke. The Polaroid Digital Camera didn't have the optical zoom; only the digital zoom. Sometimes the pictures would come out blurred or very dark. And you can only record videos up to 1 minutes. The Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP Digital Camera is way better than the other digital cameras. If you're looking for a better digital camera to buy, I highly recommend the Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP Digital Camera is the best one to buy.

Reviews.Title: CANNON POWER SHOT

Reviews.Title: A great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Barb M
Reviews.Content: I am used to a camera with many more settings and so this has taken some getting used to.  The AUTO setting works quite well for most situations and it's a nice small camera to have in my purse or pocket all the time.  My only complaint is that (as far as I can tell) the only way to choose the focus point (rather than having the camera try to identify what you want to photograph) is to have it set on Program, which means I also have to set other attributes.  My finesse for this has been to Program a fairly "standard" setting so that I usually can switch quickly over to "P" to get the "focus box."  Under most conditions, that works pretty well.  And really, for the low cost, the quality of the pictures, length of battery charge, ease of use, are all very good.  The AUTO sensor does a good job of finding faces, identifying low light, sunset, close ups, and other common situations.  I just wish I could lock in a focus point then compose the picture as I could on other cameras.  Also be warned that the camera does not come with a battery charger.  I always buy a second battery (so I don't miss pictures due to the battery running out) so I purchased one that came with a charger so that wasn't a huge deal for me - but something you should be aware of before buying it.  Otherwise you have to charge the battery while it's in the camera and your camera is out of commission for that time period.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 IS16MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: WBOGGS
Reviews.Content: I love this camera .... it does more than I expected.Takes clear and crisp pictures.Great camera for the price.W.Boggs .... Brewster, Wa.

Reviews.Title: Just okay
Reviews.Author: save our country "spread the truth!"
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Canon products and ESPECIALLY their outstanding tech support, which they have kept in the U.S.- unlike MS and all the rest. I have a larger Canon, with 20x zoom and love it and their printers as well. Major kudos for Canon Tech support....the best.But, we were disappointed with this Elf; colors were washed out; poor result low light. Perhaps we were just unlucky, don't know. We got a Nikon Coolpix instead and are well pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: No issues
Reviews.Author: Matthew J Bianco
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a Christmas present for our daughter.  Its simple to use, has just the right amount of settings and perfect zoom distance for her needs.  Photos are good quality.

Reviews.Title: it was a gift and the person loved it!

Reviews.Content: I have he same camera and it is light weight and easy to use and takes great pictures!! rechargeable battery and easy to upload pictures.

I know this is a pretty cheap camera, but it really shows that it is cheap: the screen resolution seems pretty low, focus seems to be off or not consistent, and doesn't feel very user friendly.
